forecast.review: Both forecasters largely mirror my baseline and pathways. The most useful additions were: (1) explicit emphasis on FlightsFrom’s reliance on OAG-filed schedules and the practical lead-time constraints for new routes to appear by early July, and (2) LCC aircraft/crew constraints making last‑minute seasonal adds less likely. I also agree with their clarification that FlightsFrom would list a route even if first flights are later in July, as long as schedules are filed. None of their arguments raise a concrete catalyst I had missed; rather, they modestly strengthen the case against a late-breaking fifth destination, absent current signals.
forecast.rationale: Status quo remains 3–4 destinations (GUM, ICN, PUS, intermittently NRT). To resolve Yes, SPN needs ≥5 listed destinations on FlightsFrom when checked on/after July 1. That likely requires NRT plus one more city, or two new cities if NRT drops. With ~6 weeks to go, we have no credible announcements or loaded schedules for HKG/TPE/extra KR secondary cities, while Japanese demand is still hampered by yen weakness and PRC market constraints persist. Korean demand is the most plausible upside, but LCC capacity/crew and filing lead times reduce the odds of a new route appearing in time. United’s NRT remaining visible is a necessary but not sufficient condition. Given the additional emphasis on scheduling lead times and LCC constraints from the other forecasters, I’m trimming slightly from 23% to 22%. Upside triggers: verified OAG/FlightsFrom listings for NRT and any additional city (e.g., a KR secondary, HKG, TPE, KIX/NGO). Downside triggers: NRT absent from early-July listings or any current route removed.
